column4: hello! ubuntu 8.10 amd64 user. Pulseaudio server seems to crash and I can't connect to it using teh manager app
try killing its process then starting it from the console so that it gives you output - then you'll have something to diagnose it from
I don't have a pulseaudio process right now
ok - so just start it from the terminal to see what it says
/etc/init.d/pulseaudio start   ?
nah - use 'pulseaudio'
gives you more output
W: ltdl-bind-now.c: Failed to find original dlopen loader.
for more precise output, wait for pastebin
http://pastebin.com/m4235f185
I'm also pasting my asoundconf list output
http://pastebin.com/m608cd5e9
OK - I think the problems most likely to be with it not finding the definitions
definitions ?
"Unable to find definition" <-- that problem - does pulseaudio proceed to stay running or does it die?
it keeps running
OK - so it does in the end find something that makes it work. When its running like that can you connect to it from the manager?
to describe my problem more accurately: pulseaudio seems to start properly and then for some reason it crashes, never to be restored. I can't connect even after running pulseaudio from the terminal
hmmmm that's a weird coincidence, updates only just showed up, and I have some concerning pulseaudio
I'll check if the updates fix teh prob
try installing those and see if it helps - otherwise I suggest you ask the guys in #pulseaudio - they know the software like the back of their hand
o.k. I didn't realise there was a channel for that...
Well its always best to check with distro first - in case theres a bug thats already known
